channel.title: Help with donator levels
channel.description: So if i want to make different levels of donor how do i do? EX: regular, super, respected

item.title: Help with donator levels
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

No, changing the command name would make you have to do that.

[tt]String playerToDonor = playerCommand.substring(#);[/tt]

You see that in the command; You count the letters in the [tt]playerCommand.startsWith(“respdon”)[/tt]
there are seven letters in the command name, now add one more making it eight (for the space needed to enter the player name.)

Now this [tt]String playerToDonor = playerCommand.substring(8);[/tt]

Should look like that, if you still don’t get it I will try to explain it a little better.

Read full topic

I am not 100% what my server is but it is BrokenX V2 i downloaded from mopar

item.title: Help with donator levels
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

You have so much unneeded code in that… Make it simple.

    if (playerCommand.startsWith("superdon")) {
        try {
            String playerToDonor = playerCommand.substring(9);
                for (int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) {
                   if (PlayerHandler.players[i] != null) {
                       if (PlayerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToDonor)) {
                           PlayerHandler.players[i].playerRights = 4;
                           ((Client) PlayerHandler.players[i]).getPA().requestUpdates();
                       }
                   }
              }
        } catch (Exception e) {
            c.sendMessage("Player Must Be Offline.");
        }
    }

And nothing happened because the way you had the code you needed to do ::superdon[space][space]

Read full topic

item.title: Help with donator levels
item.dc:creator: @Dario14 Dario14
item.description:
@Dario14 wrote:

Go into commands.java and put in this for super donator

if (playerCommand.startsWith("superdon")) { //this is under my owner commands so if you have your commands set to && player rights = etc add that in there try { String playerToMod = playerCommand.substring(10); for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToMod)) { Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[i]; c2.sendMessage("You have been given Super Donator status by " + c.playerName); c2.playerRights = 4;//depends what source you have this might make him a hidden owner so edit this if you need too c2.isDonator = 2; c2.logout(); break; } } } } catch(Exception e) { c.sendMessage("Player Must Be Offline."); } }

Read full topic

item.title: Help with donator levels
item.dc:creator: @Dario14 Dario14
item.description:
@Dario14 wrote:

In my server i have regular donator which is isDonator make a custom command, this is an example of a regular one

if (playerCommand.startsWith("givedonor")) { try { String playerToMod = playerCommand.substring(10); for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToMod)) { Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[i]; c2.sendMessage("You have been given donator status by " + c.playerName); c2.playerRights = 4; c2.isDonator = 1; //change to a different number to identify the donating status c2.logout(); break; } } } } catch(Exception e) { c.sendMessage("Player Must Be Offline."); } }
in this case we would change c2.isDonator = 1; which is a regular donator to a different level like c2.isDonator = 2; and a higher level of donater c2.isDonator = 3; etc. so on and so forth

Read full topic
